Hidden hallways are common, and can leave unfamiliar players feeling like they got an unwinnable map.",mdx("br",null),"
Dash along the wall, and if Shiren stops before reaching the other end, there's a hidden hallway.",mdx("br",null),"
Once you've identified the entrance, simply perform a direct attack at the wall to reveal the hallway."),mdx("p",null,"Cave Mamels appear between 2-3F, and only take 1 damage from direct attacks.",mdx("br",null),"
You can deal damage normally if you inflict Sealed status, but it's best to save Seal Staff for later.",mdx("br",null),"
So instead, use items that deal fixed damage like Rock, Porky Rock, and Electric Staff to one-shot them.",mdx("br",null),"
They have 6 HP, so a Knockback Staff use (5 damage if it hits a wall) + one direct attack can defeat them too.",mdx("br",null),"
Another option is to equip a Counter Shield (Retribution rune), but be warned that Cave Mamels hit hard."),mdx("p",null,"Dazikons appear between 2-3F, and their 2 tile radius Confusion Grass throw can be tricky to deal with.",mdx("br",null),"
Use ranged attacks like arrows to defeat them before they get close enough to throw Confusion Grass at you.",mdx("br",null),"
Approaching with direct attacks will likely cause you to lose Super status and strength."),mdx("p",null,"If you have an Anti-Cnf. Bracelet or Alert Bracelet, try to obtain Confusion Grass or Sleepy Grass for synthesis.",mdx("br",null),"
Dark Mixermons appear between 5-6F, so you still have one more chance to synthesize items before the boss.",mdx("br",null),"
Dazikon can be leveled up into Dozikon using items like Clone Staff, Cheery Grass, Fear Scroll, etc."),mdx("p",null,"Evil Sky Dragons appear between 1-3F at night, and can deal 50 fire damage from anywhere in the room.",mdx("br",null),"
Avoid them by hurrying through these 3 floors before it changes to night, skipping some items if needed.",mdx("br",null),"
If you don't make it through before it changes to night, it's recommended to wait for daytime in a hallway."),mdx("h4",null,"Tower Skywalk (4-6F)"),mdx("p",null,"Shuffle type map where you step on launch pads that send you flying to different sections of the map.",mdx("br",null),"
It's easy to get separated from allies, so do your best to keep an eye on them so that they don't get defeated.",mdx("br",null),"
Hidden traps can be generated on destination tiles as well, so it's a bit scary."),mdx("p",null,"MC Wizards appear between 4-5F, and are extremely dangerous.",mdx("br",null),"
They fire magic bullets much more frequently than their night counterparts, and can inflict Berserk status.",mdx("br",null),"
Shiren is very likely to defeat allies if he goes Berserk, and can be defeated by a Berserk ally if his shield is weak.",mdx("br",null),"
The Cloned magic bullet effect inflicts Shiren with Confused status, limiting his movement options.",mdx("br",null),"This is the last area with Magic type monsters, so use up Reflection Pot and Immunity Scroll if you have them."),mdx("p",null,"Dark Mixermons appear between 5-6F at night.",mdx("br",null),"
This is your last chance to synthesize items during the main story without a Synthesis Pot.",mdx("br",null),"
Dark Ironhead hits hard from up to 2 tiles away, so use a Monster Detector, Super Torch, or Navigation Scroll.",mdx("br",null),"
It's best to synthesize on 6F to avoid Bad Colocolum rolling into you when it's defeated by other night monsters.",mdx("br",null),"
Eat a Juicy Peach to ensure you don't get one-shot by a rolling Bad Colocolum if you're worried.",mdx("br",null),"
Wicked Trowelies appear on 6F, but shouldn't be an issue if you keep Preservation Pots full."),mdx("h4",null,"Tower Area 2 (7-9F)"),mdx("p",null,"The final stretch - Recommended to rush stairs instead of checking rooms for items.",mdx("br",null),"Special blue doors appear on these floors, which lock you in a room until all monsters are defeated.",mdx("br",null),"
Use items like Zen Pot or Confusion Scroll if you get locked in a large room with Sky Dragons."),mdx("p",null,"Nashagga (7-9F), Sky Dragon (8-9F), and Steelhead (8-9F) all have high attack power.",mdx("br",null),"
Nashagga in particular is extremely dangerous, since it attacks twice in 1 turn - avoid getting hit at all costs.",mdx("br",null),"
Use arrows to lower its HP before it's adjacent, and use a staff or scroll if it's next to you. (Talismans can miss)",mdx("br",null),"
Sky Dragons and Steelheads are weaker than in Shiren 4, but they still hit hard, so keep an eye on your remaining HP."),mdx("p",null,"Night is full of very annoying monsters.",mdx("br",null),"
Dark Scarrabit attracts you and other monsters in the room, Dark Chucker throws limit broken monsters at you,",mdx("br",null),"
and Vile Pumpanshee and Sinister Porkon ruin any plans to wait for daytime in hallways.",mdx("br",null),"
It's hard to predict what will happen at night, so it's recommended to eat a Juicy Peach if you have one.",mdx("br",null),"
